[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Watcom enables OS/2 application migration to Linux with GTK support for rendering, event handling, and layout standardization.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Watcom Porting System defines requirements for migrating Open Watcom from OS/2 to Linux using GTK for GUI adaptation.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Watcom provides GUI functionalities using GTK widgets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Watcom requires Linux distributions with GTK and X Window.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Watcom uses X Window APIs for rendering.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Watcom is optimized for low-memory GTK environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Watcom ensures stability through error handling.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Watcom is configurable for multiple Linux distributions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 MISSING-TAG2: Watcom integrates with GTK libraries, including GDK, Pango, and GLib.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: For developers experienced in Open Watcom and GTK.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Watcom requires Linux distributions with GTK and X Window support.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Watcom excludes OS/2 resource models unsupported in GTK.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: X Window System: GUI framework for Linux.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 MISSING-TAG1: Watcom standardizes GUI adaptation for GTK compatibility.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall use GTK and X Window to ensure rendering compatibility.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall support intuitive GTK layouts (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall ensure usability similar to Open Watcom (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store data for resource conversion (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall log porting activities (REQ-PERF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall render GUI within 50ms (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall handle about a hundred updates without degradation (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support modularity and updates (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall follow LGPL for GTK (REQ-COMP-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain nearly always uptime (REQ-PERF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall minimize memory leaks (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with Linux standards and follow open-source best practices.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall handle event-driven programming (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall migrate models to GTK (REQ-FUNC-23).
